page.title: 15PARISH COUNCILS
page.content: The Parish Council is democratically elected by the village every three years. It has no power, as such, but is our link with local government and planning office and can make recommendation on behalf of the village, to these bodies. Prior to every Parish council meeting there is a Democratic half hour and the inhabitants of Sydling are free to question and make suggestions to their elected council. People realise that the Parish council are frustrated by their limited powers but feel more pressure could be put on the County District Councils with regard to limiting the numbers of new houses, verge cutting road maintenance and other important matters.
